Description: Rim and neck fragment of Attic black-figured pottery neck-amphora (reconstructed from numerous sherds and added plaster) with round handles: inside rim glazed black with reserved lines; rim outside glazed black with bands in added red; on neck, black figure ornament of lotus flowers and palmettes and interlocking tendrils, red on kalyxes, fronds, and petals; at turn to shoulder black and red bands.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 125, pl. XXXVIII, no. 352.1)
CVA Boston I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum, USA Fasc. 14, Museum of Fine Arts, Boston, Fasc. 1 (p. 43, pl. 58, no. 10-11)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 233, no. 189)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0855)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4767 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
